org.swisscheese.swisscheese.map.maze

Class Generator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.swisscheese.swisscheese.map.maze.Generator

  • public class Generator
extends java.lang.Object
    The Generator class generates a maze using the CellGrid, through a variant of the Randomized Depth-First Search algorithm.

    The Randomized DFS algorithm picks an random arbitrary cell on the top side of the grid from which it will start the maze. The algorithm then proceeds to randomly pick an adjacent cell, and marks the that grid as visited and the wall between the two cells as broken. From the new cell, the algorithm picks another random adjacent cell, and repeats this process until it is in a dead-end (where all adjacent cells are marked as visited). In that case, it begins to back-track until it is able to into an unvisited cell, thus creating a branch in the maze. The algorithm continues until all maze cells are marked as visited.

    This class uses a SecureRandom to create truly random puzzles. While SecureRandom can significantly reduce performance, it is ran only once and will make a once-in-a-lifetime maze.

    Since:
    v0.1, 2018-11-14
    See Also:
    Randomized Depth-First Search

        Returns:

      • getExit

        public static GeomPoint2D<java.lang.Integer> getExit()
        Getter of the exit point of the maze. The exit point is a random location on any side (Direction) other than NORTH (starting side). Where the player should end the game.
        Returns:
        exit point of the maze.
